name: Utf8Codec
comment: A dart-convert.Utf8Codec encodes strings to utf-8 code units (bytes) and decodes UTF-8 code units to strings.

decoder.name: decoder
decoder.comment:
Returns the decoder of this, converting from dart-convert.Codec.T to dart-convert.Codec.S.

It may be stateful an should not be reused.

encoder.name: encoder
encoder.comment:
Returns the encoder from dart-convert.Codec.S to dart-convert.Codec.T.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.

name.name: name
name.comment:
Name of the encoding.

If the encoding is standardized, this is the lower-case version of one of the IANA official names for the character set (see http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets/character-sets.xml)

constructors.comment:
Instantiates a new dart-convert.Utf8Codec.

The optional dart-convert.Utf8Codec.Utf8Codec-.allowMalformed argument defines how dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decoder (and dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decode) deal with invalid or unterminated character sequences.

If it is true (and not overriden at the method invocation) dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decode and the dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decoder replace invalid (or unterminated) octet sequences with the Unicode Replacement character U+FFFD (�). Otherwise they throw a dart-core.FormatException.

decode.name: decode
decode.comment:
Decodes the UTF-8 dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decode.codeUnits (a list of unsigned 8-bit integers) to the corresponding string.

If the dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decode.codeUnits start with a leading [UNICODE_BOM_CHARACTER_RUNE] this character is discarded.

If dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decode.allowMalformed is true the decoder replaces invalid (or unterminated) character sequences with the Unicode Replacement character U+FFFD (�). Otherwise it throws a dart-core.FormatException.

If dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decode.allowMalformed is not given, it defaults to the allowMalformed that was used to instantiate this.

decoder.name: decoder
decoder.comment:
Returns the decoder of this, converting from dart-convert.Codec.T to dart-convert.Codec.S.

It may be stateful an should not be reused.

encoder.name: encoder
encoder.comment:
Returns the encoder from dart-convert.Codec.S to dart-convert.Codec.T.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-convert.Utf8Codec.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

inverted.name: inverted
inverted.comment:
Inverts this.

The dart-convert.Utf8Codec.encoder and dart-convert.Utf8Codec.decoder of the resulting codec are swapped.

name.name: name
name.comment:
Name of the encoding.

If the encoding is standardized, this is the lower-case version of one of the IANA official names for the character set (see http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets/character-sets.xml)

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-convert.Utf8Codec.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-convert.Utf8Codec.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

fuse.name: fuse
fuse.comment:
Fuses this with other.

When encoding, the resulting codec encodes with this before encoding with dart-convert.Utf8Codec.fuse.other.

When decoding, the resulting codec decodes with dart-convert.Utf8Codec.fuse.other before decoding with this.

In some cases one needs to use the dart-convert.Utf8Codec.inverted codecs to be able to fuse them correctly. That is, the output type of this (dart-convert.Codec.T) must match the input type of the second codec dart-convert.Utf8Codec.fuse.other.

Examples:

final JSON_TO_BYTES = JSON.fuse(UTF8);
List<int> bytes = JSON_TO_BYTES.encode(["json-object"]);
var decoded = JSON_TO_BYTES.decode(bytes);
assert(decoded is List && decoded[0] == "json-object");

var inverted = JSON.inverted;
var jsonIdentity = JSON.fuse(inverted);
var jsonObject = jsonIdentity.encode(["1", 2]);
assert(jsonObject is List && jsonObject[0] == "1" && jsonObject[1] == 2);

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-convert.Utf8Codec.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-convert.Utf8Codec.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-convert.Utf8Codec.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-convert.Utf8Codec.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
